snippet: No previous Congressional effort to change immigration law has offered such a broad, swift reprieve to people expelled from the United States.
abstract: Immigration overhaul legislation would allow legal second chance to tens of thousands of deportees without serious criminal records who have child, parent or spouse with green card or American citizenship; deportee measure is becoming one of bill's most contested elements, with some lawmakers viewing it as humanitarian necessity and others seeing it as shameful reward for lawbreakers.

byline.contributor: Karla Zabludovsky and Elisabeth Malkin contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: No previous Congressional effort to change immigration law has offered such a broad, swift reprieve to people expelled from the United States.

headline.seo: In Immigration Bill, Deportees See Hope for Second Chance
headline.main: In Immigration Bill, Deportees See Hope for Second Chance in U.S.
headline.print_headline: In Immigration Bill, Deportees See Hope for Second Chance in U.S.
